new().Summary: creates a new `4D.Blob` object optionally encapsulating a copy of the data from another blob (scalar blob or `4D.Blob`).

size.Summary: returns the size of a `4D.Blob`, expressed in bytes.

slice().Syntax:
**4D.Blob.slice()** : 4D.Blob
**4D.Blob.slice**( start : Real ) : 4D.Blob
**4D.Blob.slice**( start : Real; end : Real ) : 4D.Blob

index of the first byte that will not be included in the new `4D.Blob`
slice().Summary: creates and returns a `4D.Blob` that references data from a subset of the blob on which it's called. The original blob is not altered.

Object encapsulating an encryption key pair
new().Summary: creates a new `4D.CryptoKey` object encapsulating an encryption key pair

creates and returns a new object of the `4D.Folder` type

ID of attachment (HTML messages only), or " " if no cid is required
Value of the content-disposition header: "inline" or "attachment".

name.Summary: contains the name of the `4D.Class` object

Params: Parameter(s) to pass to the constructor function
new().Summary: creates and returns a `cs.className` object which is a new instance of the class on which it is called

superclass.Summary: returns the parent class of the class

New collection.Summary: creates a new empty or prefilled collection

New shared collection.Summary: creates a new empty or prefilled shared collection

ds.Summary: returns a reference to the datastore matching the current 4D database or the database designated by *localID*

Id to assign to the opened datastore on the local application (mandatory)
Open datastore.Summary: connects the application to the 4D database identified by the *connectionInfo* parameter

**MAIL Convert from MIME**( *mime* : Text ) : Object

MAIL_Convert_to_MIME.Summary: converts an email object into MIME text

Entity selection matching the dataclass related to the given table
* to return file of host database

Folder.Summary: creates and returns a new object of the `4D.Folder` type

Session.Summary: returns the `Session` object corresponding to the current scalable user web session

Params: File or Folder object to compress
File or Folder object to compress
File or Folder object to compress

ZIP Read archive.Summary: retrieves the contents of *zipFile* and returns it as a `4D.ZipArchive` object

Params: Object property path to be used for calculation
average().Summary: returns the arithmetic mean (average) of defined values in the collection instance

Params: Original collection with all elements removed
clear().Summary: removes all elements from the collection instance and returns an empty collection

Params: Position to which insert elements to combine in collection (default=length+1)
combine().Summary: inserts *col2* elements at the end or at the specified *index* position in the collection instance and returns the edited collection

Params: Number, Text, Object, Collection, Date, Time, Boolean, Picture
Value(s) to concatenate. If *value* is a collection, all collection elements are added to the original collection
New collection with value(s) added to the original collection
concat().Summary: returns a new collection containing the elements of the original collection with all elements of the *value* parameter added to the end

copy().Syntax:
**.copy**() : Collection
**.copy**( *option* : Integer ) : Collection
**.copy**( *option* : Integer ; *groupWithCol* : Collection ) : Collection
**.copy**( *option* : Integer ; *groupWithObj* : Object ) : Collection
Params:
`ck resolve pointers`: resolve pointers before copying,
`ck shared`: return a shared collection
Shared collection to be grouped with the resulting collection
Shared object to be grouped with the resulting collection
Deep copy of the original collection
copy().Summary: returns a deep copy of the collection instance

Params: Object property path to be used for calculation
Number of elements in the collection
count().Summary: returns the number of non-null elements in the collection

Params: Text, Number, Boolean, Date, Object, Collection
Object property path to be used for calculation
Number of occurrences of the value
countValues().Summary: returns the number of times value is found in the collection

Params: Path of attribute whose distinct values you want to get
New collection with only distinct values
distinct().Summary: returns a collection containing only distinct (different) values from the original collection

Params: True if collections are identical, false otherwise

every().Syntax:
**.every**( *methodName* : Text { ;*...param* : any } ) : Boolean
**.every**( *startFrom* : Integer ; *methodName* : Text { ;*...param* : any } ) : Boolean
Params: Index to start the test at
Name of the method to call for the test
True if all elements successfully passed the test
every().Summary: returns **true** if all elements in the collection successfully passed a test implemented in the provided *methodName* method

extract().Syntax:
**.extract**( *propertyPath* : Text { ; *option* : Integer } ) : Collection
**.extract**( *propertyPath* : Text ; *targetPath* : Text { ;...*propertyPathN* : Text ;... *targetPathN* : Text } ) : Collection
Params: Object property path whose values must be extracted to the new collection
Target property path or property name
`ck keep null`: include null properties in the returned collection (ignored by default). Parameter ignored if *targetPath* passed.
extract().Summary: creates and returns a new collection containing *propertyPath* values extracted from the original collection of objects

fill().Syntax:
**.fill**( *value* : any ) : Collection
**.fill**( *value* : any ; *startFrom* : Integer { ; *end* : Integer } ) : Collection
Params: number, Text, Collection, Object, Date, Boolean
fill().Summary: fills the collection with the specified *value*, optionally from *startFrom* index to *end* index, and returns the resulting collection

Params: Name of the function to call to filter the collection
New collection containing filtered elements (shallow copy)
filter().Summary: returns a new collection containing all elements of the original collection for which *methodName* method result is **true**

find().Syntax:
**.find**( *methodName* : Text { ; *...param* : any } ) : any
**.find**( *startFrom* : Integer ; *methodName* : Text { ; *...param* : any } ) : any
Params: Index to start the search at
Name of the function to call for the find
First value found, or Undefined if not found
find().Summary: returns the first value in the collection for which *methodName*, applied on each element, returns **true**

findIndex().Syntax:
**.findIndex**( *methodName* : Text { ; *...param* : any } ) : Integer
**.findIndex**( *startFrom* : Integer ; *methodName* : Text { ; *...param* : any } ) : Integer
Params: Index to start the search at
Name of the function to call for the find
Index of first value found, or -1 if not found
findIndex().Summary: returns the index, in the collection, of the first value for which *methodName*, applied on each element, returns **true**

Params: Expression to search in the collection
Index to start the search at
Index of the first occurrence of toSearch in the collection, -1 if not found
indexOf().Summary: searches the *toSearch* expression among collection elements and returns the index of the first found occurrence, or -1 if it was not found

Params: Value(s) to compare when using placeholder(s)
Element index(es) matching queryString in the collection
indices().Summary: returns indexes, in the original collection, of object collection elements that match the *queryString* search conditions

Params: Element to insert in the collection
insert().Summary: inserts *element* at the specified *index* position in the collection instance and returns the edited collection

Params: `ck ignore null or empty`: ignore null and empty strings in the result
String containing all elements of the collection, separated by delimiter
join().Summary: converts all elements of the collection to strings and concatenates them using the specified *delimiter* string as separator

Params: The element that is to be searched for within the collection
Index to start the search at
Index of last occurrence of toSearch in the collection, -1 if not found
lastIndexOf().Summary: searches the *toSearch* expression among collection elements and returns the index of the last occurrence

length.Summary: returns the number of elements in the collection

Params: Name of method used to transform the collection elements
map().Summary: creates a new collection based upon the result of the call of the *methodName* method on each element of the original collection

Params: Object property path to be used for evaluation
Boolean, Text, Number, Collection, Object, Date
max().Summary: returns the element with the highest value in the collection

Params: Object property path to be used for evaluation
Boolean, Text, Number, Collection, Object, Date
min().Summary: returns the element with the smallest value in the collection

orderBy().Syntax:
**.orderBy**( ) : Collection
**.orderBy**( *pathStrings* : Text ) : Collection
**.orderBy**( *pathObjects* : Collection ) : Collection
**.orderBy**( *ascOrDesc* : Integer ) : Collection
Params: Property path(s) on which to order the collection
Ordered copy of the collection (shallow copy)
orderBy().Summary: returns a new collection containing all elements of the collection in the specified order

Params: Name of method used to specify the sorting order
Sorted copy of the collection (shallow copy)
orderByMethod().Summary: returns a new collection containing all elements of the collection in the order defined through the *methodName* method

pop().Summary: removes the last element from the collection and returns it as the function result

Params: Element(s) to add to the collection
push().Summary: appends one or more *element*(s) to the end of the collection instance and returns the edited collection

query().Syntax:
**.query**( *queryString* : Text ; *...value* : any ) : Collection
**.query**( *queryString* : Text ; *querySettings* : Object ) : Collection
Params: Value(s) to compare when using placeholder(s)
Element(s) matching queryString in the collection
query().Summary: returns all elements of a collection of objects that match the search conditions

reduce().Syntax:
**.reduce**( *methodName* : Text ) : any
**.reduce**( *methodName* : Text ; *initValue* : any { ; *...param* : expression } ) : any
Params: Name of the function to call to process collection elements
Text, Number, Object, Collection, Date, Boolean
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of *methodName*
Text, Number, Object, Collection, Date, Boolean
reduce().Summary: applies the *methodName* callback method against an accumulator and each element in the collection (from left to right) to reduce it to a single value

Params: Element at which to start removal
Number of elements to remove, or 1 element if omitted
remove().Summary: removes one or more element(s) from the specified *index* position in the collection and returns the edited collection

Params: Number, Text, Object, Collection, Date, Boolean
Default value to fill new elements
resize().Summary: sets the collection length to the specified new size and returns the resized collection

reverse().Summary: returns a deep copy of the collection with all its elements in reverse order

shift().Summary: removes the first element of the collection and returns it as the function result

Params: Index to start the search at (included)
New collection containing sliced elements (shallow copy)
slice().Summary: returns a portion of a collection into a new collection

some().Syntax:
**.some**( *methodName* : Text { ; *...param* : any } ) : Boolean
**.some**( *startFrom* : Integer ; *methodName* : Text { ; *...param* : any } ) : Boolean
Params: Index to start the test at
Name of the method to call for the test
True if at least one element successfully passed the test
some().Summary: returns true if at least one element in the collection successfully passed a test

Params: Name of method used to specify the sorting order
sort().Summary: sorts the elements of the original collection

Params: Object property path to be used for calculation
sum().Summary: returns the sum for all values in the collection instance

Params: Value(s) to insert at the beginning of the collection
unshift().Summary: inserts the given *value*(s) at the beginning of the collection

curve.Summary: normalised curve name of the key.

Params: Message string to be decoded using `options.encodingEncrypted` and decrypted.
decrypt().Summary: decrypts the *message* parameter using the **private** key

Params: Message string to be encoded using `options.encodingDecrypted` and encrypted.
Message encrypted and encoded using the `options.encodingEncrypted`
encrypt().Summary: encrypts the *message* parameter using the **public** key

getPrivateKey().Summary: returns the private key of the `CryptoKey` object

getPublicKey().Summary: returns the public key of the `CryptoKey` object

pem.Summary: PEM definition of an encryption key to load

Params: Signature in Base64 or Base64URL representation, depending on "encoding" option
sign().Summary: signs the utf8 representation of a *message* string

size.Summary: the size of the key in bits

Params: Message string that was used to produce the signature
Signature to verify, in Base64 or Base64URL representation, depending on `options.encoding` value
verify().Summary: verifies the base64 signature against the utf8 representation of *message*

Params: References on all entities related to the Dataclass
all().Summary: queries the datastore to find all the entities related to the dataclass and returns them as an entity selection

Params: Collection of objects to be mapped with entities
Entity selection filled from the collection
fromCollection().Summary: updates or creates entities in the dataclass according to the *objectCol* collection of objects, and returns the corresponding entity selection

Params: Primary key value of the entity to retrieve
Entity matching the designated primary key
get().Summary: queries the dataclass to retrieve the entity matching the *primaryKey* parameter

getDataStore().Summary: returns the datastore for the specified dataclass

getInfo().Summary: returns an object providing information about the dataclass

new().Summary: creates in memory and returns a new blank entity related to the Dataclass

Params:
`dk keep ordered`: creates an ordered entity selection,
`dk non ordered`: creates an unordered entity selection (default if omitted)
New blank entity selection related to the dataclass
newSelection().Summary: creates a new, blank, non-shareable entity selection, related to the dataclass, in memory

Params: Value(s) to use for indexed placeholder(s)
Query options: parameters, attributes, args, allowFormulas, context, queryPath, queryPlan
New entity selection made up of entities from dataclass meeting the search criteria specified in *queryString* or *formula*
query().Summary: searches for entities that meet the search criteria specified in *queryString* or *formula* and (optionally) *value*(s)

Params: Information about the encryption of the current datastore and of each table
encryptionStatus().Summary: returns an object providing the encryption status for the current data file

getInfo().Summary: returns an object providing information about the datastore

Params: Collection of objects, where each object describes a request
getRequestLog().Summary: returns the ORDA requests logged in memory on the client side

Params: True if the Data Explorer access is disabled, False if it is enabled (default)
isAdminProtected().Summary: returns `True` if Data Explorer access has been disabled for the working session

makeSelectionsAlterable().Summary: sets all entity selections as alterable by default in the current application datastores

Params: Result of the encryption key matching
provideDataKey().Summary: allows providing a data encryption key for the current data file of the datastore and detects if the key matches the encrypted data

Params: True to disable Data Explorer access to data on the `webAdmin` port, False (default) to grant access
setAdminProtection().Summary: allows disabling any data access on the web admin port, including for the Data Explorer in `WebAdmin` sessions

Params: Number of requests to keep in memory
startRequestLog().Summary: starts the logging of ORDA requests on the client side

startTransaction().Summary: starts a transaction in the current process on the database matching the datastore to which it applies

stopRequestLog().Summary: stops any logging of ORDA requests on the client side

creationDate.Summary: the creation date of the folder

creationTime.Summary: the creation time of the folder

exists.Summary: true if the folder exists on disk

extension.Summary: returns the extension of the folder name (if any)

fullName.Summary: returns the full name of the folder, including its extension (if any)

hidden.Summary: true if the folder is set as "hidden" at the system level

isPackage.Summary: true if the folder is a package on macOS  (and exists on disk)

modificationDate.Summary: the date of the folder's last modification

modificationTime.Summary: the time of the folder's last modification

name.Summary: the name of the folder, without extension (if any)

original.Summary: the same Folder object as the folder

parent.Summary: the parent folder object of the folder

path.Summary: the POSIX path of the folder

platformPath.Summary: the path of the folder expressed with the current platform syntax

copyTo().Summary: copies the `Folder` object into the specified *destinationFolder*

file().Summary: a `File` object inside the `Folder` object and returns its reference

files().Summary: a collection of `File` objects contained in the folder

folder().Summary: creates a `Folder` object inside the parent `Folder` object and returns its reference

folders().Summary: returns a collection of `Folder` objects contained in the parent folder

Params: Side length for the returned picture (pixels)
getIcon().Summary: returns the icon of the folder

creationDate.Summary: the creation date of the file

creationTime.Summary: the creation  time of the file

exists.Summary: true if the file exists on disk

extension.Summary: the extension of the file name (if any)

fullName.Summary: the full name of the file, including its extension (if any)

hidden.Summary: true if the file is set as "hidden" at the system level

isAlias.Summary: true if the file is an alias, a shortcut, or a symbolic link

isWritable.Summary: true if the file exists on disk and is writable

modificationDate.Summary: the date of the file's last modification

modificationTime.Summary: the time of the file's last modification

name.Summary: the name of the file without extension (if any)

original.Summary: the target element for an alias, a shortcut, or a symbolic link file

parent.Summary: the parent folder object of the file

path.Summary: the POSIX path of the file

platformPath.Summary: the path of the file expressed with the current platform syntax

size.Summary: the size of the file expressed in bytes

copyTo().Summary: copies the `File` object into the specified *destinationFolder*

getContent().Summary: returns a `4D.Blob` object containing the entire content of a file

Params: Side length for the returned picture (pixels)

getText().Syntax:
**.getText**( { *charSetName* : Text } { ; } { *breakMode* : integer} ) : Text
**.getText**( { *charSetNum* : integer } { ; } { *breakMode* : integer} ) : Text
getText().Summary: returns the contents of the file as text

bcc.Summary: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) hidden email recipient addresse(s) of the email

bodyStructure.Summary: *EmailBodyPart* object, i.e. the full MIME structure of the message body (optional)

bodyValues.Summary: *EmailBodyValue* object, containing an object for each \<partID\> of `bodyStructure` (optional)

cc.Summary: Carbon Copy (CC) additional email recipient addresse(s) of the email

headers.Summary: collection of `EmailHeader` objects, in the order they appear in the message

htmlBody.Summary: HTML representation of the email message (default charset is UTF-8) (optional, SMTP only)

id.Summary: unique ID from the IMAP server

inReplyTo.Summary: message identifier(s) of the original message(s) to which the current message is a reply

keywords.Summary: set of keywords as an object, where each property name is a keyword and each value is true

receivedAt.Summary: timestamp of the email's arrival on the IMAP server in ISO 8601 UTC format (ex: 2020-09-13T16:11:53Z)

references.Summary: Collection of all message-ids of messages in the preceding reply chain

sendAt.Summary: Email timestamp in ISO 8601 UTC format

sender.Summary: email source addresse(s) of the email

size.Summary: size (expressed in bytes) of the Email object returned by the IMAP server

textBody.Summary: Plain text representation of the email message (default charset is UTF-8) (optional, SMTP only)

to.Summary: primary recipient addresse(s) of the email

clone().Summary: creates in memory a new entity referencing the same record as the original entity

Params: Entity to be compared with the original entity
Name of attributes to be compared
diff().Summary: compares the contents of two entities and returns their differences

Params: `dk force drop if stamp changed`: Forces the drop even if the stamp has changed
drop().Summary: deletes the data contained in the entity from the datastore

Params: Reference to first entity of an entity selection (Null if not found)
first().Summary: returns a reference to the entity in first position of the entity selection which the entity belongs to

Params: Object from which to fill the entity
fromObject().Summary: fills an entity with the *filler* content

Params: DataClass object to which the entity belongs
getDataClass().Summary: returns the dataclass of the entity

Params: `dk key as string`: primary key is returned as a string, no matter the primary key type
Value of the text primary key of the entity
Value of the numeric primary key of the entity
getKey().Summary: returns the primary key value of the entity

Params: Entity selection to which the entity belongs (Null if not found)
getSelection().Summary: returns the entity selection which the entity belongs to

Params: Stamp of the entity (0 if entity has just been created)
getStamp().Summary: returns the current value of the stamp of the entity

Params: Position of the entity is given according to this entity selection
Position of the entity in an entity selection
indexOf().Summary: returns the position of the entity in an entity selection

Params: True if entity has just been created and not yet saved. Otherwise, False.
isNew().Summary: returns True if the entity to which it is applied has just been created and has not yet been saved in the datastore

Params: Reference to last entity of an entity selection (Null if not found)
last().Summary: returns a reference to the entity in last position of the entity selection which the entity belongs to

Params: `dk reload if stamp changed`: Reload before locking if stamp changed
lock().Summary: puts a pessimistic lock on the record referenced by the entity

Params: Reference to next entity in the entity selection (Null if not found)
next().Summary: returns a reference to the next entity in the entity selection which the entity belongs to

Params: Reference to previous entity in the entity selection (Null if not found)
previous().Summary: returns a reference to the previous entity in the entity selection which the entity belongs to

reload().Summary: reloads the content of the entity in memory

Params: `dk auto merge`: Enables the automatic merge mode
save().Summary: saves the changes made to the entity

toObject().Syntax:
**.toObject**() : Object
**.toObject**( *filterString* : Text { ; *options* : Integer} ) : Object
**.toObject**( *filterCol* : Collection { ; *options* : Integer } ) : Object
Params:
`dk with primary key`: adds the \_KEY property;
`dk with stamp`: adds the \_STAMP property
toObject().Summary: returns an object which has been built from the entity

Params: True if at least one entity attribute has been modified and not yet saved, else False
touched().Summary: tests whether or not an entity attribute has been modified since the entity was loaded into memory or saved

Params: Names of touched attributes, or empty collection
touchedAttributes().Summary: returns the names of the attributes that have been modified since the entity was loaded into memory

unlock().Summary: removes the pessimistic lock on the record matching the entity

Params: Entity to be added to the entity selection
add().Summary: adds the specified *entity* to the entity selection and returns the modified entity selection

Params: New entity selection with the result of intersection with logical AND operator
and().Summary: combines the entity selection with an *entity* or *entitySelection* parameter using the logical AND operator

Params: Attribute path to be used for calculation
Arithmetic mean (average) of entity attribute values (Undefined if empty entity selection)
average().Summary: returns the arithmetic mean (average) of all the non-null values of *attributePath* in the entity selection

Params: True if the entity belongs to the entity selection, else False
contains().Summary: returns true if entity reference belongs to the entity selection

Params: Path of the attribute to be used for calculation
Number of non null *attributePath* values in the entity selection
count().Summary: returns the number of entities in the entity selection with a non-null value in *attributePath*

Params: `ck shared`: return a shareable entity selection
copy().Summary: returns a copy of the original entity selection

Params: Path of attribute whose distinct values you want to get
distinct().Summary: returns a collection containing only distinct (different) values from the *attributePath* in the entity selection

Params: `dk stop dropping on first error`: stops method execution on first non-droppable entity
Empty entity selection if successful, else entity selection containing non-droppable entity(ies)
drop().Summary: removes the entities belonging to the entity selection from the table related to its dataclass within the datastore

extract().Syntax:
**.extract**( *attributePath* : Text { ; *option* : Integer } ) : Collection
**.extract**( *attributePath* { ; *targetPath* } { ; *...attributePathN* : Text ; *targetPathN* : Text } ) : Collection
Params: Attribute path whose values must be extracted to the new collection
Target attribute path or attribute name
`ck keep null`: include null attributes in the returned collection (ignored by default)
extract().Summary: returns a collection containing *attributePath* values extracted from the entity selection

Params: Reference to the first entity of the entity selection (Null if selection is empty)
first().Summary: returns a reference to the entity in the first position of the entity selection

Params: Dataclass object to which the entity selection belongs
getDataClass().Summary: returns the dataclass of the entity selection

Params: True if the entity selection is alterable, False otherwise
isAlterable().Summary: returns True if the entity selection is alterable

Params: True if the entity selection is ordered, False otherwise
isOrdered().Summary: returns True if the entity selection is ordered

Params: Reference to the last entity of the entity selection (Null if empty entity selection)
last().Summary: returns a reference to the entity in last position of the entity selection

length.Summary: returns the number of entities in the entity selection

Params: Path of the attribute to be used for calculation
max().Summary: returns the highest (or maximum) value among all the values of *attributePath* in the entity selection

Params: Path of the attribute to be used for calculation
min().Summary: returns the lowest (or minimum) value among all the values of attributePath in the entity selection

Params: New entity selection or a new reference on the existing entity selection
minus().Summary: excludes from the entity selection to which it is applied the *entity* or the entities of *entitySelection* and returns the resulting entity selection

Params: New entity selection or new reference to the original entity selection
or().Summary: combines the entity selection with the *entity* or *entitySelection* parameter using the logical (not exclusive) OR operator

Params: Attribute path(s) and sorting instruction(s) for the entity selection
New entity selection in the specified order
orderBy().Summary: returns a new ordered entity selection containing all entities of the entity selection in the order specified by *pathString* or *pathObjects* criteria

orderByFormula().Syntax:
**.orderByFormula**( *formulaString* : Text { ; *sortOrder* : Integer } { ; *settings* : Object} ) : 4D.EntitySelection
**.orderByFormula**( *formulaObj* : Object { ; *sortOrder* : Integer } { ; *settings* : Object} ) : 4D.EntitySelection
orderByFormula().Summary: returns a new, ordered entity selection

Params: Value(s) to use for indexed placeholder(s)
Query options: parameters, attributes, args, allowFormulas, context, queryPath, queryPlan
New entity selection made up of entities from entity selection meeting the search criteria specified in *queryString* or *formula*
query().Summary: searches for entities that meet the search criteria specified in *queryString* or *formula* and (optionally) *value*(s) among all the entities in the entity selection

queryPath.Summary: contains a detailed description of the query as it was actually performed by 4D

queryPlan.Summary: contains a detailed description of the query just before it is executed (i.e., the planned query)

refresh().Summary: immediately "invalidates" the entity selection data in the local ORDA cache

Params: Index to start the operation at (included)
New entity selection containing sliced entities (shallow copy)
slice().Summary: returns a portion of an entity selection into a new entity selection

Params: Path of the attribute to be used for calculation
sum().Summary: returns the sum for all *attributePath* values in the entity selection

toCollection().Syntax:
**.toCollection**( { *options* : Integer { ; *begin* : Integer { ; *howMany* : Integer } } ) : *Collection*
**.toCollection**( *filterString* : Text {; *options* : Integer { ; *begin* : Integer { ; *howMany* : Integer }}} ) : *Collection*
**.toCollection**( *filterCol* : Collection {; *options* : Integer { ; *begin* : Integer { ; *howMany* : Integer }}} ) : *Collection*
Params: String with entity attribute path(s) to extract
Collection of entity attribute path(s) to extract

`dk with primary key`: adds the primary key
`dk with stamp`: adds the stamp
Collection of objects containing attributes and values of entity selection
toCollection().Summary: creates and returns a collection where each element is an object containing a set of properties and values

Params: True if the file was created successfully, false otherwise
create().Summary: creates a file on disk according to the properties of the `File` object

Params: Destination folder for the alias or shortcut
Name of the alias or shortcut
createAlias().Summary: creates an alias (macOS) or a shortcut (Windows)

Params: Contents of .exe/.dll version resource or .plist file
getAppInfo().Summary: returns the contents of a **.exe**, **.dll** or **.plist** file information as an object

Params: Full name for the moved file
moveTo().Summary: moves or renames the `File` object into the specified *destinationFolder*

Params: New full name for the file
rename().Summary: renames the file with the name you passed in *newName* and returns the renamed `File` object

Params: Properties to write in .exe/.dll version resource or .plist file
setAppInfo().Summary: writes the *info* properties as information contents of a **.exe**, **.dll** or **.plist** file

setContent().Summary: rewrites the entire content of the file using the data stored in the *content* BLOB

setText().Syntax:
**.setText** ( *text* : Text {; *charSetName* : Text { ; *breakMode* : Integer } } )
**.setText** ( *text* : Text {; *charSetNum* : Integer { ; *breakMode* : Integer } } )
Params: Text to store in the file
setText().Summary: writes *text* as the new contents of the file

Params: True if the folder was created successfully, false otherwise
create().Summary: creates a folder on disk according to the properties of the `Folder` object

Params: Destination folder for the alias or shortcut
Name of the alias or shortcut
createAlias().Summary: creates an alias (macOS) or a shortcut (Windows)

Params: Full name for the moved folder
moveTo().Summary: moves or renames the `Folder` object (source folder) into the specified *destinationFolder*

Params: New full name for the folder
rename().Summary: renames the folder with the name you passed in *newName* and returns the renamed `Folder` object

Params: Object to be returned by the This command in the formula
Collection of values to be passed as $1...$n when `formula` is executed
apply().Summary: executes the `formula` object to which it is applied and returns the resulting value

Params: Object to be returned by the This command in the formula
Value(s) to be passed as $1...$n when formula is executed
call().Summary: executes the `formula` object to which it is applied and returns the resulting value

source.Summary: contains the source expression of the `formula` as text

addFlags().Syntax:
**.addFlags**( *msgIDs* : Collection ; *keywords* : Object ) : Object
**.addFlags**( *msgIDs* : Text ; *keywords* : Object ) : Object
**.addFlags**( *msgIDs* : Longint ; *keywords* : Object ) : Object
Params:
Collection of strings: Message unique IDs (text)
Text: Unique ID of a message
Longint (IMAP all): All messages in the selected mailbox
addFlags().Summary: adds flags to the `msgIDs` for the specified `keywords`

checkConnectionDelay.Summary: the maximum time (in seconds) allowed prior to checking the connection to the server

copy().Syntax:
**.copy**( *msgsIDs* : Collection ; *destinationBox* : Text ) : Object
**.copy**( *allMsgs* : Integer ; *destinationBox* : Text ) : Object
Params: `IMAP all`: All messages in the selected mailbox
copy().Summary: copies the messages defined by *msgsIDs* or *allMsgs* to the *destinationBox* on the IMAP server

Params: Status of the mailbox creation operation
createBox().Summary: creates a mailbox with the given `name`

Params: `IMAP all`: All messages in the selected mailbox
delete().Summary: sets the "deleted" flag for the messages defined in `msgsIDs` or `allMsgs`

Params: Name of the mailbox to delete
Status of the mailbox deletion operation
deleteBox().Summary: permanently removes the mailbox with the given `name` from the IMAP server

expunge().Summary: removes all messages with the "deleted" flag from the IMAP mail server.

getBoxInfo().Summary: returns a `boxInfo` object corresponding to the mailbox *name*

getBoxList().Summary: returns a collection of mailboxes describing all of the available mailboxes

getDelimiter().Summary: returns the character used to delimit levels of hierarchy in the mailbox name

getMail().Syntax:
**.getMail**( *msgNumber*: Integer { ; *options* : Object } ) : Object
**.getMail**( *msgID*: Text { ; *options* : Object } ) : Object
getMail().Summary: returns the `Email` object corresponding to the *msgNumber* or *msgID* in the mailbox designated by the `IMAP_transporter`

getMails().Syntax:
**.getMails**( *ids* : Collection { ; *options* : Object } ) : Object
**.getMails**( *startMsg* : Integer ; *endMsg* : Integer { ; *options* : Object } ) : Object
Params: Sequence number of the first message
Sequence number of the last message

Object containing:
  • a collection of Email objects and
  • a collection of IDs or numbers for missing messages, if any
getMails().Summary: returns an object containing a collection of `Email` objects

getMIMEAsBlob().Syntax:
**.getMIMEAsBlob**( *msgNumber* : Integer { ; *updateSeen* : Boolean } ) : Blob
**.getMIMEAsBlob**( *msgID* : Text { ; *updateSeen* : Boolean } ) : Blob
Params: If True, the message is marked "seen" in the mailbox. If False the message is left untouched.
Blob of the MIME string returned from the mail server
getMIMEAsBlob().Summary: returns a BLOB containing the MIME contents for the message corresponding to the *msgNumber* or *msgID* in the mailbox designated by the `IMAP_transporter`

move().Syntax:
**.move**( *msgsIDs* : Collection ; *destinationBox* : Text ) : Object
**.move**( *allMsgs* : Integer ; *destinationBox* : Text ) : Object
Params: `IMAP all`: All messages in the selected mailbox
move().Summary: moves the messages defined by *msgsIDs* or *allMsgs* to the *destinationBox* on the IMAP server

Params: Sequence number of the first message
Sequence number of the last message
numToID().Summary: converts the sequence numbers to IMAP unique IDs for the messages in the sequential range designated by *startMsg* and *endMsg*

removeFlags().Syntax:
**.removeFlags**( *msgIDs* : Collection ; *keywords* : Object ) : Object
**.removeFlags**( *msgIDs* : Text ; *keywords* : Object ) : Object
**.removeFlags**( *msgIDs* : Longint ; *keywords* : Object ) : Object
Params:
Collection of strings: Message unique IDs (text)
Text: Unique ID of a message
Longint (IMAP all): All messages in the selected mailbox
removeFlags().Summary: removes flags from the `msgIDs` for the specified `keywords`

renameBox().Summary: changes the name of a mailbox on the IMAP server

searchMails().Summary: searches for messages that match the given *searchCriteria* in the current mailbox

selectBox().Summary: selects the `name` mailbox as the current mailbox

subscribe().Summary: allows adding or removing of the specified mailbox to/from the IMAP server’s set of “subscribed” mailboxes

unsubscribe().Summary: removes a mailbox from a set of subscribed mailboxes

getContent().Summary: returns the contents of the attachment object in a `4D.Blob` object

name.Summary: the name and extension of the attachment

path.Summary: the POSIX path of the attachment file, if it exists

platformPath.Summary: the path of the attachment file expressed with the current platform syntax

Params: Number of the message to delete
delete().Summary: flags the *msgNumber* email for deletion from the POP3 server

getBoxInfo().Summary: returns a `boxInfo` object corresponding to the mailbox designated by the `POP3 transporter`

Params: Number of the message in the list
getMail().Summary: returns the `Email` object corresponding to the *msgNumber* in the mailbox designated by the `POP3 transporter`

Params: Number of the message in the list
getMailInfo().Summary: returns a `mailInfo` object corresponding  corresponding to the *msgNumber* in the mailbox designated by the `POP3 transporter`

getMailInfoList().Summary: returns a collection of `mailInfo` objects describing all messages in the mailbox designated by the `POP3 transporter`

Params: Number of the message in the list
Blob of the MIME string returned from the mail server
getMIMEAsBlob().Summary: returns a BLOB containing the MIME contents for the message corresponding to the *msgNumber* in the mailbox designated by the `POP3_transporter`

undeleteAll().Summary: removes all delete flags set on the emails in the `POP3_transporter`

keepAlive.Summary: **True** if the SMTP connection must be kept alive until the `transporter` object is destroyed

send().Summary: sends the *mail* object to the SMTP server defined in the `transporter` object and returns a status object

clearPrivileges().Summary: removes all the privileges associated to the session

expirationDate.Summary: the expiration date and time of the session cookie

Params: Name of the privilege to verify
True if session has *privilege*, False otherwise
hasPrivilege().Summary: returns True if the privilege is associated to the session, and False otherwise

idleTimeout.Summary: the inactivity session timeout (in minutes), after which the session is automatically closed by 4D

Params: True if session is a Guest one, False otherwise
isGuest().Summary: returns True if the session is a Guest session (i.e. it has no privileges)

Params: Object with a "privileges" property (string or collection)
setPrivileges().Summary: associates the privilege(s) defined in the parameter to the session

storage.Summary: a shared object that can be used to store information available to all requests of the web client

userName.Summary: the user name associated to the session

description.Summary: contains a custom description for the `Signal` object.

signaled.Summary: contains the current state of the `Signal` object

trigger().Summary: sets the `signaled` property of the signal object to **true**

Params: Maximum waiting time for the signal in seconds
wait().Summary: makes the current process wait until the `.signaled` property of the signal object to become **true** or the optional *timeout* to expire

acceptUnsecureConnection.Summary: **True** if 4D is allowed to establish an unencrypted connection

authenticationMode.Summary: the authentication mode used to open the session on the mail server

bodyCharset.Summary: the charset and encoding used for the body part of the email

connectionTimeOut.Summary: the maximum wait time (in seconds) allowed to establish a connection to the server

headerCharset.Summary: the charset and encoding used for the email header

host.Summary: the name or the IP address of the host server

logFile.Summary: the path of the extended log file defined (if any) for the mail connection

port.Summary: the port number used for mail transactions

sendTimeOut.Summary: the maximum wait time (in seconds) of a call to `.send( )` before a timeout occurs

user.Summary: the user name used for authentication on the mail server

Params: Status of the transporter object connection
checkConnection().Summary: checks the connection using information stored in the transporter object

accessKeyDefined.Summary: true if an access key is defined in the settings of the web server

certificateFolder.Summary: folder where the certificate files are located

characterSet.Summary: character set that the 4D Web Server should use to communicate with browsers connecting to the application

cipherSuite.Summary: cipher list used for the secure protocol

CORSEnabled.Summary: CORS (*Cross-origin resource sharing*) service status for the web server

CORSSettings.Summary: list of allowed hosts and methods for the CORS service

debugLog.Summary: status of the HTTP request log file

defaultHomepage.Summary: name of the default home page

HSTSMaxAge.Summary: maximum length of time (in seconds) that HSTS is active for each new client connection

HTTPCompressionLevel.Summary: compression level for all compressed HTTP exchanges for the 4D HTTP server (client requests or server replies)

HTTPCompressionThreshold.Summary: size threshold (bytes) for requests below which exchanges should not be compressed

HTTPPort.Summary: listening IP port number for HTTP

HTTPSPort.Summary: listening IP port number for HTTPS

inactiveProcessTimeout.Summary: life duration (in minutes) of the inactive legacy session processes

inactiveSessionTimeout.Summary: life duration (in minutes) of inactive legacy sessions (duration set in cookie)

IPAddressToListen.Summary: IP address on which the 4D Web Server will receive HTTP requests

keepSession.Summary: True if legacy sessions are enabled in the web server, False otherwise

maxConcurrentProcesses.Summary: maximum number of concurrent web processes supported by the web server

maxRequestSize.Summary: maximum size (in bytes) of incoming HTTP requests (POST) that the web server is allowed to process

maxSessions.Summary: maximum number of simultaneous legacy sessions

minTLSVersion.Summary: minimum TLS version accepted for connections

name.Summary: name of the web server application

openSSLVersion.Summary: version of the OpenSSL library used

rootFolder.Summary: path of web server root folder

scalableSession.Summary: True if scalable sessions are used in the web server, and False otherwise

sessionCookieName.Summary: name of the cookie used for storing the session ID

sessionIPAddressValidation.Summary: IP address validation for session cookies

Params: Web server settings to set at startup
Status of the web server startup
start().Summary: starts the web server on which it is applied

stop().Summary: stops the web server on which it is applied

root.Summary: a virtual folder providing access to the contents of the ZIP archive
